checkboxesWithChildren.name: Checkboxes With Children
checkboxesWithChildren.description: This section displays checkbox with children functionality of the JSF. The hierarchical control extends the section control. This will display a checkbox with a label. When the checkbox is checked, it will display child items underneath it in a hierarchical structure. When the input is unchecked, the children are re-hidden. Note: The children form objects can be any form control type.

dropdowns.name: Dropdowns
dropdowns.description: Dropdowns can be required or not required. If no values are passed in, the form will display "Select an option..." by default. If the dropdown is required, then the default option will be hidden once the user has selected a value. If the dropdown is not required, the default option will always be present.

securedTextInput.name: Secured Text Inputs
securedTextInput.description: This will mask the text in the form, and will be used as a flag to the backend to indicate that this is sensitive data that needs to be stored securely. When the form is being edited, the secured value is never returned and there will be a password placeholder within the text input. If a field is marked as secured, but is not required, there will be a "unset" link next to the text input. This will allow the user to unset the value.
